original: Zetterberg, John August Albin, ci-viUngenjör, Göteborg, f. 27/5/84 i Tyresö, Sthlms 1., av disp. Sven August Z. o. Anna Christina Andersdotter. G. 12 m. Carin Steiner. Barn: Sven Gustav f. 13, ing., ASEA, Gbg, Sten Gustav 15, d. 22, Stig Carl 19, civ:ing., ASEA, Västerås, Anna Gunvor Elisabeth 26. — Mog:ex. i Sthlm 04, KTH (E) 04-06 o. 08-09. Provrumsing. v. Nya Fören. Elektr. A-B i Ludvika 07-09, montageing. där 09-11, chef f. Bodens El. A-B o. Sikfors Kraft A-B 11-13, chef f. Nya Fören. El. A-B fil. i Malmö 13-16, chefsassist. v. ASEA fil. i Sundsvall 16-20, chef f. dess fil. i Umeå 20-25, i Gbg sed. 25. Ordf. i styr. f. El. entrepr :fören. Gbgsavd. o. El. propagandafören. i Gbg, v. ordf. i styr. f. El. arb :giv :fören. Gbgsavd., rev. i off. stift. m. m. Medl. av div. ordens-sällsk. Res. t. Finl., Norge, Danm., Tyskl, Engl. o. Frankr. PatrM m. m.
translated: Zetterberg, John August Albin, civil engineer, Gothenburg, born on 27/5/1884 in Tyresö, Stockholm County, son of dispenser Sven August Z. and Anna Christina Andersdotter. Married on 12 to Carin Steiner. Children: Sven Gustav, born in 1913, engineer at ASEA in Gothenburg, Sten Gustav (1915-1922), Stig Carl, born in 1919, civil engineer at ASEA in Västerås, Anna Gunvor Elisabeth, born in 1926. Completed his bachelor's degree in Stockholm in 1904, studied at the Royal Institute of Technology (Electrical Engineering) from 1904-1906 and 1908-1909. Worked as a testing engineer at Nya Förenade Elektriska A-B in Ludvika from 1907-1909, and as an installation engineer there from 1909-1911. Became the manager of Bodens Elektriska A-B and Sikfors Kraft A-B from 1911-1913, manager of Nya Förenade Elektriska A-B's subsidiary in Malmö from 1913-1916, assistant manager at ASEA's subsidiary in Sundsvall from 1916-1920, and manager of its subsidiary in Umeå from 1920-1925, and in Gothenburg from 1925 onwards. Chairman of the board for the Electrical Contractors Association's Gothenburg branch and the Electrical Propaganda Association in Gothenburg, vice chairman of the board for the Electrical Employers Association's Gothenburg branch, auditor for various public foundations, and more. Member of various fraternal societies. Traveled to Finland, Norway, Denmark, Germany, England, and France. Passed away, etc.
